pageContext._xxxcollectionOwnerNamextxt: J. Willard Marriott Library, Special Collections, University of Utah
pageContext._xxxcollectionTitlextxt: Alvin G. and Lena M. Pack Papers
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: Pack was a pioneer in the radio broadcasting industry who worked primarily with KALL and KSL. Included are radio scripts, correspondence, newsclippings and personal and professional papers. Boxes 1-14 contain scripts, 1931-1945, for ongoing feature programs written mainly by Pack, including Famous Furniture Stories, Organ Stories, Pioneer Stories and Spelling Bee as well as some audition scripts and campaign proposals. A separate collection includes photographs of KSL. See online finding aid for a list of the programs and dates.
